page.title: 01Stroma
page.content: Stroma is an island in the Pentland Firth 3 kilometres north west of John O'Groats in Caithness. The Island is 3 kilometres long and 1 1/2-2 kilometres wide. It was inhabited until the 1960s when its economy declined and it was abandoned. There are several crofts and a school all of which are now derelict. The only inhabitants on Stroma now are 3 lighthouse keepers in the lighthouse at the north end of the island at Swilkie Point. Access to Stroma is difficult because there is no longer any boat service. This area of the survey only includes the shore line on the east side of the island.
